Def.Name: Heartleaf Willow
Def.Description: Multi-trunk, small tree. Fast growing and short lived. Normally grows 13' in height.
Def.Leaves: Simple, 2" - 6" long and 3/8" - 1 7/16" wide. Base may be heart shaped and have stipules. Fine toothed margins, green on top; whitish with hairs below.
Def.Twigs: Brown, gray, red, purple, or yellow. May have white hairs. Bud has one scale or cap.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule on catkin. See Black Willow.
Def.Bark: Dark and scaly. On older trees may be smooth and thin.
Def.Remarks: Will be found in swamps, marshes, ditches and the edge of lakes and streams. Some buterfilies will be present.
